title: Build and link the Industries We Serve page with structured industry blocks and lead capture

requirements.text: Create a new standalone route/page for the Industries We Serve page and render the full publish-ready content provided by the user using the following section structure in order: (1) Hero section with headline, subheadline, supporting line, and CTA "Request Founder Blueprint"; (2) "Our Focus" section describing the target business profile and explicitly stating you do not serve early-stage startups; (3) Four industry blocks (Manufacturing SMEs, Distributors & Trading Companies, Professional Service Firms, Second-Generation Leadership Teams) where each block includes three clearly labeled subparts: "Common Challenges", "What We Implement", and "Outcome"; (4) "What stays consistent across industries" section with the provided bullet points and closing lines; (5) "Is This Right for You?" qualifying statement section with fit/not-fit messaging; (6) Lead generation section with headline, subheadline, and form; (7) Final CTA block with headline and "Book Strategy Call" button; and (8) a short "Caffeine AI prompt" block at the end (as requested by the user) presented as copyable text.

quotes: now lets build and link the industries page. below is the structre i want ... üöÄ INOVICS ‚Äì Industries We Serve Page ... 4Ô∏è‚É£ Short Caffine AI prompt at the end

acceptanceCriteria: Navigating to the Industries page route renders all sections in the exact order specified above.
All headings, subheadings, bullets, and CTA labels match the user-provided content verbatim (English user-facing text).
Each of the four industries is displayed as its own section and includes labeled subsections for Common Challenges, What We Implement, and Outcome.
A final block exists at the bottom containing a short Caffeine AI prompt, displayed as plain text with an obvious copy-to-clipboard interaction.

requirements.text: Add site navigation linking to the new Industries We Serve page: update the top navigation so that "Industries" navigates to the new Industries page route (not the homepage #industries anchor), while keeping existing routing behavior for other links (e.g., CONTROL‚Ñ¢).

quotes: now lets build and link the industries page

acceptanceCriteria: Clicking "Industries" in the top navigation takes the user to the Industries page route and scrolls to the top.
The CONTROL‚Ñ¢ link continues to navigate to /control-framework as it does currently.
Homepage hash-based navigation (Framework/Process/Insights/Contact) continues to work as it does currently.

requirements.text: Implement lead capture integration on the Industries page by adding a lead-generation form in the Lead Generation section with these fields: First Name, Last Name, Company Name, Industry (Dropdown), Revenue Range, Biggest Operational Bottleneck, Work Email, Mobile Number; and a submit CTA labeled "Request Industry Blueprint". On submit, persist the lead using the existing frontend submission hook and backend addLead API, packaging the additional fields into the lead message payload similarly to the existing Control lead form pattern.

quotes: SECTION 5 ‚Äì LEAD GENERATION ... Form Fields: First Name ... Mobile Number ... CTA: Request Industry Blueprint

acceptanceCriteria: All listed fields are present on the Industries page form, with required-field validation and inline error states consistent with the existing lead form UX.
The submit button label reads exactly "Request Industry Blueprint".
Successful submission calls the backend addLead method and shows a success state (thank-you/confirmation) without a full page crash.
The stored lead message includes Company Name, Industry, Revenue Range, Mobile Number, and Biggest Operational Bottleneck (in addition to name + email stored in their dedicated fields).
The small text "We partner with a limited number of businesses each quarter." is shown below the submit CTA in the lead-gen section.

requirements.text: Wire the Industries page CTAs to the appropriate on-page actions: (a) the Hero CTA "Request Founder Blueprint" should scroll the user to the Industries page lead-generation form section; (b) the Final CTA "Book Strategy Call" should trigger the same strategy call action used elsewhere in the app.

quotes: FINAL CTA BLOCK ... Button: Book Strategy Call

acceptanceCriteria: Clicking "Request Founder Blueprint" on the Industries hero scrolls smoothly to the lead-generation form section on the same page.
Clicking "Book Strategy Call" triggers the existing strategy call behavior (mailto) used in other pages.
Scrolling offsets account for the fixed top navigation so section headers are not hidden under the nav.

constraints: Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui (read-only UI component sources).
Do not edit frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, or frontend/src/main.tsx (immutable paths).
Backend must remain a single Motoko actor (all logic in backend/main.mo); only add migration.mo if an incompatible state upgrade is required.
nonGoals: Do not add third-party authentication providers (only Internet Identity is supported).
Do not introduce external databases or non-Motoko backend services.
Do not rewrite the existing homepage IndustriesSection content unless necessary for linking behavior; the new Industries page is the primary deliverable.
